newsitem.title: CHINA: China capital opens software market to fight piracy.
newsitem.headline: China capital opens software market to fight piracy.

text.p: China has opened its first wholesale market for computer software and electronic publications as part of its battle against copyright piracy of such products, the Xinhua news agency said Thursday.
The Beijing market, supervised by government departments and selling authorisd electronic publications and software, was the first of its kind in China, Xinhua said.
"The market should help to regulate the sector, fight against copyright piracy and protect intellectual property rights," the agency said.
More than 900 foreign-invested firms and some 20,000 Chinese companies are engaged in developing and selling computer software in Beijing, it said.
Chinese authorities say they confiscated more than 10 million illegal laser discs, compact discs and other electronic publications in 1996 as part of the crackdown on piracy.

The United States and China went to the brink of a multi-billion-dollar trade war last year over Washington's allegations that Beijing was not doing enough to combat violations of intellectual property rights.
